item.title: Monica add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Monica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "She knows herself to be at the mercy of events, and she knows by now that events have no mercy." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Monica add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "A half-read book is a half-finished love affair." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Monica add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "My life amounts to no more than one drop in a limitless ocean. Yet what is any ocean, but a multitude of drops?" -- David Mitchell

item.title: Monica add a quote by Isaac Marion
item.description: "What wonderful thing didn't start out scary?" -- Isaac Marion

item.title: Monica add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "Do they sense it, these dead writers, when their books are read? Does a pinprick of light appear in their darkness? Is their soul stirred by the feather touch of another mind reading theirs? I do hope so. " -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Monica add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Bea says that the art of reading is slowly dying, that it's an intimate ritual, that a book is a mirror that offers us only what we already carry inside us, that when we read, we do it with all our heart and mind, and great readers are becoming more scarce by the day." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón
